Title: How World of Warcraft Private Servers Work Total Breakdown
Description:
To learn for free on Brilliant, go to https://brilliant.org/Tariq10x/ . Youâ€™ll also get 20% off an annual premium subscription.

Ever wondered how World of Warcraft private servers actually work behind the scenes? In this video, I dive deep into the C++ source code of AzerothCore, explaining the architecture, networking, and gameplay logic that makes these servers possible.

Weâ€™ll walk through how the server handles client connections, authentication, packet parsing, and game world simulation. Iâ€™ll also highlight some of the clever software engineering tricks and reverse engineering techniques used by developers to recreate the server side.

Whether youâ€™re interested in game development, MMORPG server emulation, or just curious about the C++ code that powers private servers, this breakdown will give you an inside look at the technical details and architecture that make it all work.
If you enjoy this kind of code review and game architecture analysis, check out my other videos on Doom, Quake, Diablo, and more classic game engines!

Title: The Silk Road vs. Sapiens: Why Popular History Shouldn't Mean False History
Description:
Christopher Columbus set sail in 1492, â€œcertain though he was of finding the Great Khan â€“ and of the role he would play in the liberation of Jerusalem.â€ Not to spread enlightenment, as Yuval Noah Harari would have us believe in Sapiens, but on a religious mission to defeat Muslims and claim wealth for Christian Europe.
This single quote from Peter Frankopanâ€™s The Silk Road captures exactly what frustrated me so deeply about Sapiens. Where Harari spins a neat story about European exploration driven by academic curiosity and enlightenment values, Frankopan provides the messy, complicated, properly researched truth: Columbus was a religious zealot seeking the Great Khan to fight a holy war.
